text:
On tap... Golden orange in color... light biscuity doughy aroma... flavor is bread, biscuits, light caramel... solid 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(Tap) clear, bright pale golden colour with a small white head; faint aroma of flowers; light, balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish; smooth palate. Wish all pala lagers were that good!

Tap at Bangers, Austin. Clear yellow color, small white head. Light sweetish malty, corn-like aroma, hints of citrus. Light-bodied. Citrusy front, then clean sweet maltyness. Refreshing but a pale lager.
12 oz. can. Pours a clear pale golden color with a white head. Aroma of light citrus and grains. Taste is grains, citrus, floral notes. Clean and crisp. Quite flavorful for a pale lager.

Can. Pours a cloudy bright orange color. Head is white with right bubbles. Hops on the nose but not overbearing. Some pine and grain. Flavor is dry grain, slight clay, floral notes with a lightly bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Crystal clear golden, no head. Bright fruit, quite a bit of malty grain. Quite bitter as far as lagers go, solid malt body. Really clean, chewy light body. Good.

Tap at the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy yellow. White head with average retention. Aroma is grain, light grass, faint citrus, toast. Taste is grain, faint citrus, light toasted caramel, light hoppy bitterness. Very nice flavors from something in the pale lager style.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Tap at Austin Ale House, Austin. Pours light clear yellow, white head. Aroma is lemon, berry,bm strawberry, no doubt the best pale lager aroma I?ve smelled. Flavor is a little more disappointing. It?s got some nice citrus, a nice body, but IS ultimately still a pale lager. Still excellent for the style.

12-oz. can. Moderate carbonation lifts the scents of fresh grapefruit, lemon, and tangerine from the tulip glass; faint cracker-like malt and a surprising (and late-blooming) touch of jasmine whisper underneath the fruity hop tones. The beer pours a light lemon color with a brief head. Unfortunately, the taste isnt nearly as interesting as the aroma, as a rather subdued lemon flavor blends with bland lavosh and some grassy hop bitterness at the end. Light body. I suspect the age of this can (9/15/15) has robbed what I remember to be an enjoyable lager of its better attributes.
Tangerine right up front on the nose when you open a can. That dissipates pretty quickly though. Thin, lightly carbonated. Good beer for drinking a lot of.
On tap at the brewery. Nothing like an expertly crafted lager. Beautiful to look at, full of flavor, very satisfying. I could drink this for a while ( that says a lot.

Can, small bubbly head, slightly pale and a bit hazy orange color, herbal hoppy aroma with some citrus, hint of light bready maltiness, quite subtle, herbal hops flavor, empathic bitterness, mild maltiness behind it. lingering bitter aftertaste. Excellent hoppy lager, textbook stuff.

Can in the limo van on the way to JFK. Big thanks to the Sandman. Pours clear, yellow-gold with a foamy white head. The nose has some biscuits, hay, grain, faint citrus, bread crust. Great flavor, super well balanced, with some further bread and biscuits, sourdough, cereal, slight lemon rind, light bitter straw. Light in body with average carbonation. Nicely balanced finish with a touch of tangerine meringue, cereal, more biscuits. Delicious beer. So quaffable.
Austin, Tx - on tap at the Lamar St., Whole Foods. Neutral aroma. Light snow-white head. Grainy aroma. Light green apples, slight nuttiness in the flavor. Crisp mouthfeel. Uneventful.

Floral, spicy hops, some pine, some grass, earthy minerals, pepper, and malted grain in the nose. The mouthfeel is a bit lifeless, with a runny body and only adequate carbonation. The taste is hoppy bitter, with a dry, grainy finish. Leans green and dank for a lager.
Pours a pale gold with a white head. Aroma is pils malt, citrus, tangerine, grass. Flavor is mostly the same, light sweet and beautifully hopped. Very nice hoppy sessionable lager.

Pale gold, aroma is light yeast, floral hints from the dry hopping. The body and carbonation is normal. The flavor is clean with some of the hops showing in the finish. Very well for the style. I sampled at the source inna 10 oz glass.
Can, gold pour, white head, nose and taste are pretty hoppy for a pale lager, good
On draft. Holy dank. If I was blindfolded I would swear this is one of lagunitas stanky dank ass brews. Good stuff though.

Can thanks to my Winter Secret Santa. Cloudy orange-gold pour with very little head that fades to nothing. Aroma is pretty fruity. Oranges, grapefruit, light grass, light dankness, and some flowers. Tastes very smooth. Nice graininess blends well with citrus and floral hops. Grassy finish. Medium body. A very nice pale lager.
Really gooxd brew. Great hoppy aroma. Very clear, perfect carbonation. Drinkable at any climate, all around solid brew.

"Well, there you have it. The best pale lager Ive ever had. Makes you wonder when to ignore what the brewer calls a beer. Not especially pale for a plae lager, so is it really just a lager? Hopped like an IPA almost. Wonderful aroma has the sweet malt/corn base but with very floral and fruity hops backing it up. Taste is much the same, very mellow and very satisfying. The body also stood out. A little fuller than expected and very very smooth. I feel bad for drinking it solo and not sharing, but who knew? Well, Suds did, but who else? ;)"
Draft at the source. Cloudy yellow orange color. Aroma of bitter orange peel. Taste is bitter citrus. Nice body.
Pours a clear gold from tap with some head. Not much aroma but sweet. Medium mouth feel with a bunch of carbonation. Taste is a littly malty sweet and a little hoppy.
Pale Lager. Crisp citrus grapefruit aroma. Light head, pale thin appearance. Clean crisp taste, IPA Lite, light bitterness on palate.
Can via trade. A strong hoppy nose with a light fishy note. As it warns it smells like sushi. Taste is much better but still hop forward. Ok.

Can thanks to CLoaker! Pours hazy butterscotch, medium off-white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, grass, hay, dankness. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, citrus, dank notes. Light body, creamy mouthfeel. Pretty darn tasty. Another of the line of India Pale Lagers that are taking over the lager leaderboard on RateBeer.

I have to side with the majority on this one--its pretty awesome for the style, i have a lot of respect for this beer, diving into an often-maligned and under appreciated style and looking for gold...they found it! Tons of taste, not too bitter, not sweet, just right for a refreshing little pale lager!

Pours clear gold with very little head out of can. Good aroma of hops with pine and citrus. Flavor of citrus and grass with hop finish. Good beer but nothing special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Extra in a trade. Clear deep straw gold. Terrific fresh hop nose, light pine and citrus. Lightly bready with some grass and pine. Nice little lager here coming from a non-lager fan.

Pours a nice clear amber color with white head. Some nice hop notes on the nose, pine and citrus with just a little caramel malt; follows onto the palate. A very easy drinking beer, and just delicious.

Can via trade. Cheers, Jason! The pours light gold with a modest white head. Biscuity malt nose. Some lemon cake and citrus zest. Nice grassy hoppiness elevates this above the usual boring pale lager nose. Similarly deft, grassy bitterness. Creamy light malty sweetness. Crisp, active carbonation. Overall, very good for what it is.

Received in trade. Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a hazy golden yellow color with a decent transparency to it, enough to see a soft ever so small carbonation rising at a moderate pace, white foamy head rises just a bit and falls adequately like a normal American Pale Lager. The llacing is sporadic and kinda all over the place.
The smell had crisp grains, light corn, slightly spicy and has what seems to be some lemon zest (I think).
The taste was at first bitter but lends a slightly sweet side to try to come out. There isnt any aftertaste and it has a dry crisp finish.
On the palate, it sits about a light on the body and is pretty sessionable. Carbonation is good for an American Pale Lager and for me as theres a nice crisp texture rolling about my mouth and tongue.
Overall, hey, what a nice American Pale Lager and in cans. Holy cow, I only poured it out for a proper review, but honestly, next time if there ever is, well I wouldnt mind having this fishing and right outa the can.

Sampled at the 2014 Untapped festival in Fort Worth. Pours a hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of pine with a good amount of grass and a sweet grain backing. Flavor has notes of grass and pine with some grass and a touch of sweetness.
Pours a light hazy yellow with a white frothy head. Aroma of citrus, a bit of stone fruits, and light hay. Flavor is sweet with a hoppy grapefruit bite. Overall a delicious beer.
Pours pale yellow with nice carb. Aroma is really fruity and citrus hops, taste is fairly bitter with a light body, nice pale lager
Hazy light golden straw colored pour. Medium sized white head. Some lacing left behind. A grainy lemon aroma. Taste is a bland malt. Kind of husky tasting. Finish is a bit bitter.

Pours bright gold with a thin white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, lager yeast, biscuit and pineapples. Taste is slightly bitter yet, sweet with lager biscuit notes. Smooth and drinkable, citrus and tropical fruit. Not bad

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 Can: very muddled rustic amber color with a nice sized, chunky off white head that lasts forever as a mild skin & collar. Aroma is mildly spicy hops, grain, some lightly baked bread, a faint bit of citrus/lemon, yeast, & faint metallic notes. Taste has lots of lightly sweet cereal grains & baked bread, good amount of lemon-lime, orange rind, fresh grapefruit flesh, slight musty & leafy hop notes with a spicy, almost Saaz-like character. Finish of mild lemon & orange, bready grains, & musty hops. Very nice lager... Could crush this.

Can:   Straw, a little dusty/dirty, and fiery, thin white frothy head, spotty lacing.   Very soft and sweet straw/hay, a touch doughy, smidgen of breadiness.   Soft mealy and bready start, hay and straw on the backside.   Heavier than most Pale Lagers, and less grassy.   Fairly clean.   Body and mouthfeel are moderate.   Perhaps a touch chewy.   Sweet hay and straw on the finish.   Not a fan of Pale Lagers, but this was pretty clean and a touch bigger than most.   Thanks Bill!

Admittedly I dont very often care for any kind of lagers. The taste just simply isnt my thing. So that being said, keep that in mind. However, I think this is a ridiculously good beer. Way more worthy than the over all score currently. 

Beautiful hoppy aroma, but definitely not over the top. Crisp, Refreshing, but not bitter. I could see myself drinking the hell out of this during the hot summers.

Great Job H&G!
Pours a chill hazed yellow color with a lacy white head. Notes of corn, honey, grass, ammonia.
Clear pale golden with a thin white cap head. The nose is a little biscuity but very leafy/grassy, like a craft pilsner. Tastes the same, though with a slight citrus kick. Very lovely and complex.
Smell is perfumy hops. Fruity and bright. Taste is smooth and refreshing and hoppy but only lightly bittered. Still hoppy for the style. Easy drinking and flavorful. Very good.
12oz can 11/13/13 (Whole Foods-Lamar)-Pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of hops, bread, and malt. Taste of the same with a bit more hops. This light bodied brew is pretty darn tasty.

Aroma: Floral, Bready Malts, Oats, Mild Spruce

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw/Mild Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Fluffy White Head, Mild Sticky Lacing

Taste: Grainy Malts, Oats, Mildly Floral, Mild Honey

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Got in a trade with Cyde. 12 ounce can into lager glass; no canning date, but should be pretty fresh. Pours lightly hazy golden amber color with a 1 finger fairly dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tangerine, lemon zest, peach, mango, pineapple, floral, grass, bread, light caramel, and floral/yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good complexity and balance of hop, malt, and yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of tangerine, grapefruit, lemon zest, peach, mango, pineapple, bread, light caramel, floral, grass, and floral/yeast earthiness. Light floral bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, pineapple, peach, mango, bread, light caramel, floral, grass, and floral earthiness on finish. Very nice complexity of citrus/tropical hop flavors with balanced malt sweetness; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth and lightly crisp mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very nice hoppy pale lager style. Nice complexity and balance of hop and malt flavors; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

I really like this. It's an easy drinker that's crisp, lite a little dry and slightly hoppy. Wish I could get this in Dallas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared by Bobby. Clear golden pour with a white head. Nice hoppy aroma. Grapefruit, orange, and floral hops. Bready malt, grass, and grainy sweetness. Mild malt sweetness up front. Some bread and grain. Floral hops, plenty of citrus peel, and a light bitterness.
355mL can thanks to t0rin0. Pours a clear, light golden. Nose is fresh citrus, IPA citrus hops. Taste is rustic, citrus hops. Sharper, stinging carbonation. Mild soap and paper.

12 fl oz can. Traded with Rosebud butternuts. Thanks!
Clear golden colour with a big white foamy head. 
Bitterish hops, grapefruit and malt in the aroma. The flavour is grapefruit and bitter hops. Tasty lager. Rich palate for a Pale Lager.

12 oz can. Pours light gold and a little hazy with little head. Light grapefruit nose. Starts off grainy in the nose then the grass and grapefruit come through. Body is full for a lager. Nice and flavorful-great drinkable lager.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: 12 oz can. Misty brass brown with a frosting. Nose is faintly sweet and grassy with hints of orange. Smooth medium body, crisp but not biting. Taste is pith and peel, white pepper and clean stones. I could bang these all night long with some Tex-Mex. Impressive, what a pale lager should be.
Can from HEB. Lighter pour with a white head. Aroma is grassy and grains. Taste is grass, light spice, and almost toasty.

25 July 2013, can. Yellow. Nose is lemon and stale straw. Thin body and fizzy. Sugary, yellow fruit, straw. Interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer sits in my glass with a little bit of a haze in a bright, yellow/orange colored body with steady, moderate carbonation and a fizzy, bright white head. It definitely looks pale. The nose is a great bouquet of bready malts, fresh grain sweetness, and a mysterious herbal, almost candy-like plant-like hop character. Caraway seeds? Coriander? My own hallucinations?

In the mouth, well, my first impression is how soft and smooth it is, especially on the lips. Man, what a great mouth feel. Some great, spicy, earthy hop bitterness is showcased here, softly decorated with a light residual sweetness. Hops and a touch of lemon/lemon verbena, perhaps, in the finish. This is extremely good, especially for a lager. This could very well be the best pale lager Ive ever had. Smooth, hoppy, stifly-flavored, yet still refreshing and super sessionable. Great choice of hops here. What an experience. Dont let the style dissuade you... this is fantastic, more like a bready, generously hopped pilsener than what youd expect of a lager. No nasty, sulfury lager characteristics. Its clean and gorgeous.

Can from Whole Foods, cloudy/unfiltered copper in color, tastes of nothing, really disappointed, wanted to like the local so much; hear good things on Dog and Alt 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Pours a perfect gold-amber with a very slight chill haze. Head is creamy white with large bubbles and lacy foam. The nose is floral, resinous, and citrus, a very pleasant balance. A touch of stone fruit sweetness on the front of the mouth opens up into balanced bitterness and malty sweetness. Finishes long and slightly acidic, with a very clean fruity bite. Damn, thats good.

Pours an amber golden color. Odd, no real detectable aroma... what i can barely detect is hard to place. Good clean sweet malty flavor with a touch of piney hops. Overall tasty! Thanks to BarZigKin for sharing!
Canned at treasure island, aroma and Flavors of tasty bready citrus and caramel, nice medium bodied finish

Slightly hazy amber with a thin white head. Sweet malt aroma with some faint citrus and bread. Taste has a honey characteristic but not too sweet. Theres some citrus rind in there too. Medium body. Solid beer.

Hazy golden appearance with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of floral, light citrus, with notes of straw and malt. Taste is lightly grassy, a little floral and a little grapefruit, with some malt sweetness, bread, and caramel.
(12oz can) Pours a lightly hazy yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, stone fruit, and grass. Flavor of grapefruit, grain, florals, and grass with a crisp, bitter finish.

honestly, its really ugly. like really bad. hazy gold, a tiny fizzy white head with no retention and no lacing. sort of like a soda. citrus, spruce, peppery floral, cereal, bready malt, lemon. light bitter, light tart, very light sweet. light body, slick feel, clean and crisp. absolutely worth a look, even if youve given up on lagers.

12 ounce can thanks to Errl. Pours a semi-hazy copper color with a fluffy, bubbly white head of foam. Good retention. Aroma is grassy and citrusy, a lot like cascade and citra was used. Taste is a subtle fruity bitterness with a sweetness that picks up about mid palate and rides through to a juicy finish. This is unlike any pale lager Ive ever had, and it is very good.

Can.  The look is clear, golden orange in color, with a thin big bubble not long lasting off white head.  The smell is hops, citrus, melon, grapefruit, and sticky.  The taste is sweet, hops, fruits, crisp, and nice.

12 oz. can poured into shaker- I know, the beerbitches here will proclaim,"Hes drinking ANOTHER pale lager... ugh!" accompanied by acting that as worse as porn, but, frankly, they can suck me raw like sushi, and call me Obama while they do it.  Poured a transparent, with an ever so tint of murkiness to it darkened yellow color.  Two finger white foamy head became a one finger white foamy head in the time I thought about, and wrote this- impressive!  Aroma of grass, hops, and light grain- not too shabby!  Hits the mouth with a light body, malt is encased in an almost candi sugar sweetness but the malt can still be found (the farmboy says just a touch of rye is present, am I right?), middle is very impressive- it doesnt start to fade away, in fact, it becomes stronger, finish is brisk, firm, and slightly acidic from the hops.  To be honest, the first thing that popped in my mind while tasting this was the 1980s version of Strohs (MI brew- nevermind Texughtuckys) - firm pale brew, yet slightly acidic, and it refused to turn to water throughout the entire six pack!  And trust me, thats not a bad thing.  Not a bad thing at all...Twirl your finger in the air.  You know what that means?  HOME RUN!  Great job Hops & Grain, you have the competition beat for a summer beer.

From a can. Great hop aroma but tastes under carbonated. Light green hop flavor, more citrus than bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of citrus hops and floral Grapefruit. Pours a clear amber with a none lasting white head and spotty lacing. The taste is much like the nose. Floral and fruity. Medium-light body and crisp carbonation. Overall, a good Texas summer time quencher. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This stuff is great, no way this doesnt shoot up into the top pale lagers list!! .. . amber .. . medium foam .. . nice hoppiness, hay also .. . quite clean, great beer! .. . . dead mouse on my desk?? ... . . you earned it!

Can. Multiple cans, I should say. Dark for a "pale" lager, orange pour with a fine white head with low to medium duration and low to no lacing. Nose is citrus and resin, biscuit, grain, light straw. Flavor is quite peachy, citrus, grain, a clean and crisp lager taste as well, with an mid dry finish and medium carbonation. This is an excellent session beer, I look forward to enjoying this on warm Texas days. Thank God for Austin and its beer scene.
Yellow pour, white head.  Crisp citrus, clean and refreshing.  Easy palate, light citrus hops, clean finish.  Lawn mower beer

On tap at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Yellow with a white head. The aroma and flavor are full of biscuity, pale malt, with some grass and a light hint of citrus. There is a touch of malty sweetness as well. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Golden pour, thin but tight head.  Touch of Pils malt and European hops in the nose.  Slightly sweet.  Across the tongue there are faint apricots coupled with solid malt.  Hops dry the finish pleasantly.  Good lager.

Pretty robust looking for a pale lager. Lots of rich golden color and pure white foamy head. The aroma is balanced erring on the sweet side. Lots of malt and bitterness in the flavor. Medium thick mouthfeel. Good lacing on the glass. I guess this is what bud was like before they hired the marketing graduates. If your last beer was bad this one can fix that.

Sample at the Draught House brewpub. The beer is a slightly hazy orange color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of bready malt and hops. Light body with flavors of grassy hops, malt and a bit of fruit. The finish is mildly bitter with an herbal, hoppy aftertaste. Above average overall.
